node.title: Ireen Wüst becomes the first person to win individual golds at five Olympics.
node.alt: Ireen Wüst of the Netherlands on her way to setting an Olympic record in the women’s 1,500-meter speedskating race in Beijing on Monday.
node.description: The Dutch speedskater, 35, set an Olympic record in the 1,500 meters.
node.content: ["BEIJING \u2014 \u201cWho says I\u2019m too old?\u201d the Dutch speedskater Ireen W\u00fcst asked recently. Nobody will say that, not after W\u00fcst, 35, won yet another gold medal, in the women\u2019s 1,500-meter race Monday evening. W\u00fcst\u2019s time, 1 minute 53.28 seconds, also set an Olympic record.", "The gold medal, W\u00fcst\u2019s sixth, adds to her mind-boggling list of accomplishments. It is her 12th Olympic medal overall, more than any other speedskater and third most among Winter Olympians. She is the first person to win an individual gold medal at five Olympics \u2014 she first won the 3,000 meters in Turin in 2006 \u2014 and the oldest speedskating gold medalist ever.", "W\u00fcst was followed by Japan\u2019s Miho Takagi, who holds the world record and has been the best 1,500 skater this season, and by her fellow Dutchwoman Antoinette de Jong.", "The American Brittany Bowe, who was hoping to win her first individual Olympic medal, finished a disappointing 10th."]
